    Wide to Long Data Splitting with Advanced Transformation Capabilities

    w2l_split.Rd

    Transforms wide-format data to long format with flexible splitting and grouping options, supporting multiple data type conversions.

    w2l_split(data, cols2l, by = NULL, split_type = "dt", sep = "_")

    Arguments

    data

    A data.frame or data.table to be transformed and split.

    cols2l

    Columns to be transformed from wide to long format. Can be specified as numeric indices or column names.

    by

    Optional grouping columns for additional data stratification.

    split_type

    Output format for split data, either "dt" (data.table) or "df" (data.frame). Defaults to "dt".

    sep

    Separator used for generating list names when grouping. Defaults to "_".

    Value

    A list of data.tables or data.frames, split according to specified parameters.

    Details

    The function provides comprehensive wide-to-long data transformation with the following advanced features:

    • Flexible column specification (numeric indices or names)

    • Automatic data type conversion

    • Intelligent handling of grouping variables

    • Customizable output data type

    • Robust error checking and validation

    Transformation Strategy:

    1. Converts input to data.table format

    2. Melts specified columns to long format

    3. Splits data based on optional grouping variables

    4. Generates list names using grouping values

    Column Specification Options:

    • Numeric indices of columns to transform

    • Character vector of column names

    • Comprehensive validation of provided columns

    Note

    • Supports complex data transformation scenarios

    • Handles mixed input data types

    • Provides detailed error messages for invalid inputs

    • Efficient data manipulation using data.table

    Examples

    w2l_split(data = iris, cols2l = 1:3)
#> $Sepal.Length
#>      Petal.Width   Species value
#>            <num>    <fctr> <num>
#>   1:         0.2    setosa   5.1
#>   2:         0.2    setosa   4.9
#>   3:         0.2    setosa   4.7
#>   4:         0.2    setosa   4.6
#>   5:         0.2    setosa   5.0
#>  ---                            
#> 146:         2.3 virginica   6.7
#> 147:         1.9 virginica   6.3
#> 148:         2.0 virginica   6.5
#> 149:         2.3 virginica   6.2
#> 150:         1.8 virginica   5.9
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width
#>      Petal.Width   Species value
#>            <num>    <fctr> <num>
#>   1:         0.2    setosa   3.5
#>   2:         0.2    setosa   3.0
#>   3:         0.2    setosa   3.2
#>   4:         0.2    setosa   3.1
#>   5:         0.2    setosa   3.6
#>  ---                            
#> 146:         2.3 virginica   3.0
#> 147:         1.9 virginica   2.5
#> 148:         2.0 virginica   3.0
#> 149:         2.3 virginica   3.4
#> 150:         1.8 virginica   3.0
#> 
#> $Petal.Length
#>      Petal.Width   Species value
#>            <num>    <fctr> <num>
#>   1:         0.2    setosa   1.4
#>   2:         0.2    setosa   1.4
#>   3:         0.2    setosa   1.3
#>   4:         0.2    setosa   1.5
#>   5:         0.2    setosa   1.4
#>  ---                            
#> 146:         2.3 virginica   5.2
#> 147:         1.9 virginica   5.0
#> 148:         2.0 virginica   5.2
#> 149:         2.3 virginica   5.4
#> 150:         1.8 virginica   5.1
#> 
w2l_split(data = iris, cols2l = c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width"))
#> $Sepal.Length
#>      Petal.Length Petal.Width   Species value
#>             <num>       <num>    <fctr> <num>
#>   1:          1.4         0.2    setosa   5.1
#>   2:          1.4         0.2    setosa   4.9
#>   3:          1.3         0.2    setosa   4.7
#>   4:          1.5         0.2    setosa   4.6
#>   5:          1.4         0.2    setosa   5.0
#>  ---                                         
#> 146:          5.2         2.3 virginica   6.7
#> 147:          5.0         1.9 virginica   6.3
#> 148:          5.2         2.0 virginica   6.5
#> 149:          5.4         2.3 virginica   6.2
#> 150:          5.1         1.8 virginica   5.9
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width
#>      Petal.Length Petal.Width   Species value
#>             <num>       <num>    <fctr> <num>
#>   1:          1.4         0.2    setosa   3.5
#>   2:          1.4         0.2    setosa   3.0
#>   3:          1.3         0.2    setosa   3.2
#>   4:          1.5         0.2    setosa   3.1
#>   5:          1.4         0.2    setosa   3.6
#>  ---                                         
#> 146:          5.2         2.3 virginica   3.0
#> 147:          5.0         1.9 virginica   2.5
#> 148:          5.2         2.0 virginica   3.0
#> 149:          5.4         2.3 virginica   3.4
#> 150:          5.1         1.8 virginica   3.0
#>
